columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to analyze the statements regarding exchange rate movements.
We are going to evaluate the impact of the announcement to the American Importer and American Exporter doing business with the foreign country in the given scenarios.

## a.

The officials in the administration of the U.S. government have announced that they are comfortable with the rising euro relative to dollar.

A rising euro relative to dollar indicates that *more dollars are required to purchase euros*.  For an **American importer**, this announcement will be **bad** for them since if they are importing from European countries, they need **more dollars** to get the goods making it more expensive to import.

On the other hand, for an **American exporter**, this announcement will be **good** for them since if they are exporting to European countries, they will get more dollars since the value of dollars is lower than the euros. When the euros will be converted into dollars, the exporter will gain more income.

## b.

British monetary authorities announce that they feel the pound has been driven too low by currency speculators relative to the dollar.

This statement has the same impact on statement a. For an **American importer**, this situation is **bad** since fewer goods can be imported as more dollars are required to purchase pounds. On the other hand, for an **American exporter**, this situation is **good** since more goods can be exported since lesser pounds are required in exchanging dollars.

## c.

The Brazilian government announces that it will print billions of new reals and inject them into the economy in an effort to reduce the countryâ€™s unemployment rate.

Printing many currencies at some point in time will result to reals having a lower currency value compared to other currencies. Hence, *less dollars are required  to purchase reals*.  For an **American importer**, this announcement will be **good** for them since if they are importing from Brazil, they need **less dollars** to get the goods reducing the cost to import.

On the other hand, for an **American exporter**, this announcement will be **bad** for them since if they are exporting to Brazil, they will get less dollars in return. Since the value of dollars is higher than the reals, the exporter will have a lower income since the reals must be converted into dollars.

As a conclusion, the increase in the value of the dollar compared to other currencies is good for American importers while it is bad for the American exporters. 
\
On the other hand, the decrease in the value of the dollar compared to the other currencies is good for American exporters while it is bad for the American importers.
